entries.title: Web app deployment completed with auto-summarization features
entries.whats_new: The AI-powered changelog web app has been finished, enabling automatic summarization of Git commits. API is deployed on Railway and front-end on Vercel. Unnecessary codes have been cleaned.
entries.breaking_change: The web app's core functionality now automatically summarizes changes based on Git commits, providing users with concise summaries; previous manual processes are replaced.
entries.impact: Users will receive automatically generated change summaries, improving clarity and reducing effort to manually compile change logs.

entries.title: Enhanced breakage detection with improved summarization
entries.whats_new: API now accurately detects and summarizes breaking changes within commits using a large language model (LLM).
entries.breaking_change: The system now automatically identifies and reports breaking changes within commits, which previously required manual detection.
entries.impact: Users will be informed about significant changes that may affect their usage, preventing unexpected issues.

entries.title: Open customization options for users
entries.whats_new: Users can now configure their own Git repositories, OpenAI LLM settings, and API keys as part of the changelog system.
entries.breaking_change: The deployment now supports user-specific configuration for integrations, allowing personalized setups.
entries.impact: Users gain flexibility to tailor the changelog tool to their own repositories and preferences, enabling a more customized experience.

entries.title: Cache strategy and bug fixes implemented
entries.whats_new: The system now caches changelog data locally and via GitHub API for efficiency. Bugs in saving to GitHub and Git methods have been fixed.
entries.breaking_change: The caching mechanism ensures faster access to changelogs and more reliable data storage, replacing previous static fetch methods.
entries.impact: Users will experience faster load times and fewer errors when interacting with their repositories.

entries.title: Interface management and front-end improvements
entries.whats_new: Interfaces have been collected into a single file for easier management. Front-end pages have been decorated with loading effects and improved layouts.
entries.impact: Enhanced user interface and manageable code structure improve overall usability and maintainability.

entries.title: Changelog page interaction improvements
entries.whats_new: Clicking on a specific changelog entry now navigates to detailed view. The front-end layout has been centered and the icon changed to Greptile.
entries.breaking_change: Navigation behavior has changed to allow direct access to details, improving user exploration.
entries.impact: Users can now easily view detailed information of each change, making the experience more intuitive.

entries.title: Back-end API and cache integration
entries.whats_new: Back-end now generates a JSON cache for changelogs, which the front-end loads directly. Layout has been adjusted for better presentation.
entries.breaking_change: The API now utilizes a JSON cache, significantly changing how changelog data is fetched and displayed.
entries.impact: Faster data retrieval and more consistent display of changelogs for users.

entries.title: Initial front-end web interface
entries.whats_new: A basic web interface has been built, allowing users to view changelogs generated automatically by OpenAI, including date, news, impact, and breaking changes.
entries.breaking_change: Introduction of a user-facing web interface for changelogs, replacing prior manual or static methods.
entries.impact: Users now have a visual and interactive platform to understand project evolutions easily.
